observations: Input and output grids have the same dimensions.
Other rows have some values replaced with a new color.
New colors appear in the bottom part of non-'4' rows.
The color replacement pattern changes based on row location.
Columns also show invariant and variant sections defined by '4' delimiters.
hypotheses: Rows and columns containing only '4's remain unchanged; other rows and columns have a color replacement pattern affecting only some cells and dependent on relative position to '4' boundaries.
Rows and columns with '4's are delimiters. Number of changes in a particular row or column relate to the index of the row or column within the delimited region.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: All non-'4' rows have the same simple color mapping applied.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: Color replacements vary across different rows and columns.

selected_rule: Rows and columns containing only '4's remain unchanged; other rows and columns have a color replacement pattern affecting only some cells and dependent on relative position to '4' boundaries. The specific replacement rule is: 1 becomes 6 and 0 becomes 3, or vice versa in some cases, near the bottom of the grid.
step_plan: Identify rows and columns containing only '4's and leave these unchanged.
For other rows and columns, apply color mapping: 1 -> 6, 0 -> 3, vice versa near the bottom, preserving other values.
